detaileddescription.para: Struct containing the type information for a catch-all

briefdescription.para: Converts a Javascript epoch to a Datum.

detaileddescription.para:
c double Javascript epoch
#Datum of type DATEADT

briefdescription.para: Converts a Javascript epoch to a Datum.

detaileddescription.para:
c double Javascript epoch
#Datum of a timestamptz

briefdescription.para: Converts a DateADT Datum to a Javascript epoch.
Converts a TimestampTz Datum to a Javascript epoch.
Makes a copy of a #text type from Postgres and returns a cstring.

detaileddescription.para: Takes the input of a Postgres TEXT field, allocates memory in the current memory context, and returns a \0 terminated copy of the string that was stored. It is up to the caller to free the memory allocated.

simplesect.para: char * copy of the text field

briefdescription.para: Converts an SPI status into static text.
Helper for getting the length of a Javascript array.

parameterdescription.para: JSValueConst - Javascript array to check the length of

briefdescription.para: Converts an Oid into pljs_type.

detaileddescription.para: Takes an input of a pointer to pljs_type and an Oid, and queries Postgres for enough information for type conversions between Postgres and Javascript.

parameterdescription.para: pljs_type - the location to store the type data

briefdescription.para: Converts a #Datum for a Javascript object.

detaileddescription.para: Takes a #Datum and converts it to a Javascript object. If there is an error, throws a Javascript exception.

simplesect.para: #JSValue of the object or thrown exception in case of error

briefdescription.para: Converts a Postgres array to a Javascript array.

detaileddescription.para: Takes a Postgres #Datum and type and converts it into a Javascript array. All properties are set, including array length.

parameterdescription.para: #Datum - Postgres array to convert @oaram type pljs_type - type information for the array

briefdescription.para: Default type conversion from @Datum to @JSValue.

detaileddescription.para: If a type is unknown, instead of returning undefined or NULL, do a cstring or varlena, or value based conversion to an String or Int32 and back.

In the case of fixed-length INTERNALLENGTH, it will be a String with those bytes copied into the string, and the length set appropriately. When the String is variable, the length would be taken from the varlena header, and the rest copied into the string.

memberdef.argsstring: (Datum arg, Oid argtype, JSContext *ctx, bool skip_composite)
memberdef.name: pljs_datum_to_jsvalue

briefdescription.para: Converts a Postgres #Datum to a Javascript value.

detaileddescription.para: Takes a Postgres #Datum and type and converts it into a Javascript value. If the type is an array or is composite, then call out to the correct functions. If skip_composite is true, then the value is directly converted, even if it is composite. There is currently only one case for this: conversion from a window function.

parameterdescription.para: #Datum - Postgres array to convert @oaram type pljs_type - type information for the type
bool - whether to skip the composite check

simplesect.para: #JSValue of the value, or JS_NULL if unable to convert

briefdescription.para: Converts a Javascript array to a Postgres array.

detaileddescription.para: Takes a Javascript #JSValue of an array and type and converts it into a Postgres array.

parameterdescription.para: #JSValue - Javascript array to convert @oaram type pljs_type - type information for the array
#FunctionCallInfo - needed to conversion back to a #Datum

briefdescription.para: Determines whether a Javascript object contains all of the column names.

detaileddescription.para: Takes a Javascript #JSValue object and the possible column names and determines whether all of the column names are reflected in the object.

parameterdescription.para: #JSContext - Javascript context to execute in @oaram tupdesc #TupleDesc

memberdef.argsstring: (JSValue val, pljs_type *type, JSContext *ctx, bool *is_null, TupleDesc tupdesc, Tuplestorestate *tupstore)
memberdef.name: pljs_jsvalue_to_record

briefdescription.para: Converts a Javascript object into a Postgres record.

detaileddescription.para: Takes a Javascript object and converts it into a Postgres record (composite Postgres type).

parameterdescription.para: #JSValue - the Javascript object to convert @oaram type pljs_type - type information for the record
bool - pointer to fill of whether the record is null

briefdescription.para: Default type conversion from @JSValue to @Datum.

detaileddescription.para: If a type is unknown, instead of returning NULL, do a cstring or varlena, or value based conversion to an Datum.
In the case of fixed-length INTERNALLENGTH, it will be a cstring with those bytes copied into the cstring. When the String is variable, a varlena will be used and the size set appropriately.

memberdef.argsstring: (JSValue val, Oid rettype, JSContext *ctx, FunctionCallInfo fcinfo, bool *isnull)
memberdef.name: pljs_jsvalue_to_datum

briefdescription.para: Converts a Javascript value to a Postgres #Datum.

detaileddescription.para: Takes a Javascript value and converts it into a Postgres #Datum, checking whether it is an array or record and converting it properly.

parameterdescription.para: #JSValue - the Javascript object to convert @oaram type pljs_type - type information for the record
bool - pointer to fill of whether the record is null

briefdescription.para: Converts an array of Javascript values into a Javascript array.

detaileddescription.para: Takes an array Javascript values and converts it into a Javascript array of values, starting at the index requested.

parameterdescription.para: int - number of values to convert
int - index to start the conversion

briefdescription.para: Converts a Postgres #HeapTuple to a Javascript value.
Converts a Postgres SPI result to a Javascript value.
